snippet: An appeals court panel affirmed the Federal Communications Commission’s rules about net neutrality, clearing the way for stricter oversight of broadband providers.
abstract: Federal court rules in case regarding net neutrality regulations that high-speed internet service is utility, essential service similar to phones and electricity; ruling, which could have far-reaching impact in digital landscape, confirms views first espoused by Federal Communications Commission when it began legal battle for neutrality in 2015.
lead_paragraph: An appeals court panel affirmed the Federal Communications Commission’s rules about net neutrality, clearing the way for stricter oversight of broadband providers.

headline.main: Court Backs Rules Treating Internet as Utility, Not Luxury
headline.print_headline: Court Backs Rules Treating Internet as Utility, Not Luxury
